title: List of prime ministers of Australia - Wikipedia
snippet: The prime ministership of Frank Forde, who was prime minister for seven days in 1945, was the shortest in Australian history. Menzies served the longest, with eighteen years over two non-consecutive periods. The current prime minister is Anthony Albanese, who assumed office on 23 May 2022.

title: Anthony Albanese - Wikipedia
snippet: A 2002 reshuffle saw him become Shadow Minister for Employment Services and Training, and in 2004 he became Shadow Minister for Environment and Heritage. It was during this latter role that then prime minister John Howard and science minister Brendan Nelson started raising the idea of nuclear ...

title: Australia's prime ministers | naa.gov.au
snippet: Anthony Albanese (2022– ): Australian Labor Party · Edmund Barton (1901–03): first Prime Minister of Australia and first Australian-born prime minister · Chris Watson (1904): first Labor prime minister and first national Labor government leader in the world ·

title: Prime Ministers | MOAD
snippet: The Prime Minister is the head of the Australian Government. This position is achieved by being the leader of the party, or coalition, with a majority of seats in the House of Representatives. ...
